    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      BayesianLogFactor​(int[] domain, int[] sizes, double[] data)
      This assumes that the data are ordered with the same order of the variables in the given domain and not in log-space.

      This assumes that the data are ordered by the given domain and not in log-space.

      This assumes that the data are ordered by the given stride and not in log-space.

      This assumes that the data are ordered with the same order of the variables in the given dataDomain and not in log-space.
      BayesianLogFactor​(BayesianDefaultFactor factor)
      This creates a new factor with the same domain and the data of the given factor.
      BayesianLogFactor​(BayesianFactor factor)
      This creates a new factor with the same domain and the data of the given factor.

      • BayesianLogFactor

        public BayesianLogFactor​(int[] domain,
                         int[] sizes,
                         double[] data)
        This assumes that the data are ordered with the same order of the variables in the given domain and not in log-space.
        Parameters:
        domain - variables that compose the domain
        sizes - size of each variable
        data - ordered by the given domain

      • BayesianLogFactor

        public BayesianLogFactor​(Strides stride,
                         int[] dataDomain,
                         double[] data)
        This assumes that the data are ordered with the same order of the variables in the given dataDomain and not in log-space.
        Parameters:
        stride - stride of this factor
        dataDomain - order of the variables in the data
        data - ordered by the given dataDomain

      • BayesianLogFactor

        public BayesianLogFactor​(BayesianDefaultFactor factor)
        This creates a new factor with the same domain and the data of the given factor. Data are copied using the ArraysUtil.log(double[]) method, they will be in log-space, and they will follow the same domain of the given factor.
        Parameters:
        factor - factor to construct this new factor from

      • BayesianLogFactor

        public BayesianLogFactor​(BayesianFactor factor)
        This creates a new factor with the same domain and the data of the given factor. Data are recovered using the getLogValueAt(int) method, they will not be in log-space, and they will follow the same domain of the given factor.
        Parameters:
        factor - factor to construct this new factor from

      • marginalize

        public BayesianLogFactor marginalize​(int variable)

        Marginalize a variable out of the factor. This corresponds to sum all parameters that differ only in the state of the marginalized variable.

        If this factor represent a Conditional Probability Table you should only marginalize variables on the right side of the conditioning bar. If so, there is no need for further normalization.

        Specified by:
        marginalize in interface BayesianFactor
        Specified by:
        marginalize in interface OperableFactor<BayesianFactor>
        Overrides:
        marginalize in class BayesianDefaultFactor
        Parameters:
        variable - the variable to be summed out of the CPT
        Returns:
        a new BayesianLogFactor with the variable marginalized out.

      • combine

        public BayesianLogFactor combine​(BayesianFactor factor)

        If the input factor is also a BayesianLogFactor, a fast algebra i used. If the input is a BayesianDefaultFactor, the factor will be first converted in the log-space.

        Specified by:
        combine in interface BayesianFactor
        Specified by:
        combine in interface OperableFactor<BayesianFactor>
        Overrides:
        combine in class BayesianDefaultFactor
        Parameters:
        factor - input factor
        Returns:
        a BayesianLogFactor, combination of the this with the other factor

      • addition

        public BayesianLogFactor addition​(BayesianDefaultFactor factor)

        If the input factor is also a BayesianLogFactor, a fast algebra i used. If the input is a BayesianDefaultFactor, the factor will be first converted in the log-space.

        Overrides:
        addition in class BayesianDefaultFactor
        Parameters:
        factor - input factor
        Returns:
        a BayesianLogFactor, sum of the probabilities of this with the other factor

      • divide

        public BayesianLogFactor divide​(BayesianFactor factor)

        If the input factor is also a BayesianLogFactor, a fast algebra i used. If the input is a BayesianDefaultFactor, the factor will be first converted in the log-space.

        Replace all Double.NaN values with the given replacement value.
        Overrides:

        Parameters:

      • scale

        public BayesianLogFactor scale​(double k)
        Multiplies all value by a given constant. The data are first converted to normal-space, scaled, then converted again in log-space.
        Overrides:
        scale in class BayesianDefaultFactor
        Parameters:
        k - constant multiplier
        Returns:
        a new BayesianLogFactor scaled by the given constant

      • sample

        public ObservationBuilder sample()
        Description copied from class: BayesianDefaultFactor
        Sample the distribution of this factor. In case of more than one variable in the the domain, the probabilities are normalized and hence the factor is considered to be a joint distribution.
        Specified by:
        sample in interface BayesianFactor
        Overrides:
        sample in class BayesianDefaultFactor
        Returns:
        An ObservationBuilder that can be used as evidence
